p: The total phenolic content was determined by the Folin–Ciocalteu assay as previously described [ 17]. In brief, 20 µL of each sample was mixed with 100 µL of Folin–Ciocalteu phenol reagent and 80 µl of sodium carbonate solution (75 g/L). After incubation for 30 min at room temperature, the absorbance was measured at 765 nm. A calibration curve was plotted using gallic acid solutions (31.25, 62.5, 125, 250, and 500 µg/mL). Total phenolic content was determined as µg gallic acid equivalent per ml of nipa palm vinegar ( µg GAE/mL).
